etymologies: early 19th century: from French néphéline, from Greek nephelē ‘cloud’(because its fragments are made cloudy on immersion in nitric acid) + -ine

definitions: a colorless, greenish, or brownish mineral consisting of an aluminosilicate of sodium (often with potassium) and occurring as crystals and grains in igneous rocks.
shortDefinitions: colourless, greenish, or brownish mineral consisting of aluminosilicate of sodium often with potassium and occurring as crystals and grains in igneous rocks
